Crafted UX

With expertise in the design and implementation of Motion, Interaction, and UI, it is my delight to be the difference that moves good to great.

Who I Am

I make extraordinary user experiences come to life.

I live at the intersection of the user, data, technology and design, and blend UX design and engineering expertise into a single progressive discipline. My focus on understanding user experience problems, technical capabilities, and opportunities on both fronts enables me to craft compelling experiences that are intuitive, thoughtful, simple and delightful.

Over the span of my 20 year career, I have spent my time as an individual contributor, a mentor, a manager, and a champion for process improvements that close the gaps between teams in order to deliver world class user experiences.

What I've Done

2016 - 2020

For the last 4 years, I have worked as a Sr. Design Technologist and Sr. Manager of Design Technology at Vrbo. At Vrbo I have created high-fidelity prototypes for usability labs as well as production components for the live site. I have contributed to bringing motion, layout, and interaction polish to the final product and have also composed production demos and advised teams around their UI implementation strategy. View Vrbo Portfolio

2011 - 2020

In addition to Vrbo, I maintain one contract client, Dr Steven Grey (MSU), whom I partnered with in 2011 to create Mental Modeler, a fuzzy-logic cognitive mapping web application. Mental Modeler is comprised of a concept mapper and a scenario suite, both of which I designed and implemented. We hae been award numerous grants including a million dollar NSF Cyberlearning grant in 2012. The software is accessed by 50,000 users per year and has produced more the 40 academic publications in 2018 alone. The concept mapper was original writen in Actionscript 3 and I ported it to React/Redux in 2019. I also created 2 instructional websites for Mental Modeler.

View Mental Modeler

2001 - 2016

Prior to working at Vrbo, I work at Pearson Education (2010 - 2016) on their high-stakes, summative assessment testing client (both Actionscript 3/Flex and HTML5). At Pearson, I also designed and lead the UI development for ABBI, their high-stakes testing content creation tool. Before that, I reveled in the digital agency life at Springbox (2007-2010), delivering rich media experiences to a host of clients including Disney, PayPal, LG, Nascar, Experien, and Dell. I considered my real start to be at Enspire Learning (2001 - 2007) where i made lasting connections with co-workers and got my footing as both a UX designer and an engineer. And, of course, all throughout my career, I have done a random project here or there, both for the love of creation and to learn.
